summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2024 between attorneys at Wigdor LLP discussing the process of obtaining and reviewing a client's journals, which are intended to be turned over in relation to a matter involving Leon Black. The emails reference a letter sent to Judge Rakoff containing confidential exhibits.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Lead attorney communicating about obtaining client consent to turn over journals and coordinating review of documents related to the Leon Black matter.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney who sent a confidential letter to Judge Rakoff regarding the Leon Black matter and is copied on internal strategy emails.

persons.name: Meredith Firetog
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails regarding the status of obtaining client journals for the Leon Black matter.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The individual who is the subject of the legal correspondence and investigation, prompting the attorneys to seek client journals.

persons.name: Judge Rakoff
persons.context: The judge to whom a confidential letter regarding the Leon Black matter was sent.

connections.description: Partners at Wigdor LLP collaborating on the Leon Black case, with Christensen sending documents per Wigdor's instruction.
Attorneys at the same firm, with Firetog being copied on case updates regarding client journals.
Wigdor represents a client in a matter involving Leon Black, positioning Black as the subject/opposing party.
Christensen sent a confidential letter to Judge Rakoff regarding the Leon Black matter.

events.title: Letter sent to Judge Rakoff
events.description: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen sent a letter to Judge Rakoff regarding the Leon Black matter, which included a highly confidential Exhibit C.

events.title: Attorney consultation with client
events.description: Douglas Wigdor planned to speak with his client the following day (March 6) about obtaining consent to turn over all of her journals.

events.title: Status update on journal review
events.description: Wigdor provides an update that they are preparing for a hearing and working on obtaining client consent to turn over journals, acknowledging the delay.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor LLP office address)
keyFacts: Attorneys from Wigdor LLP are actively working on a legal matter involving Leon Black and are in the process of obtaining a client's consent to turn over her journals.
A confidential letter with a highly confidential Exhibit C was sent to Judge Rakoff on Friday, March 1, 2024, regarding the Leon Black matter.
The attorneys note that the client's journals require explanation as they "are not all obvious as to meaning," suggesting they contain coded or unclear entries relevant to the case.
The email chain demonstrates an ongoing legal strategy session and document review process related to the Epstein/Black case in March 2024.
